full_summary:
================================

# Request for Proposal: Shallow Water/Bay Water Patrol Boat

## Procurement Details

| **Field** | **Value** |
| --- | --- |
| **Reference Number** | WS4125050887-Doc4465119527 |
| **Solicitation Number** | WS4125050887 |
| **Publication Date** | 2024-03-11 |
| **Tender Closing Date** | 2024-03-26T14:00:00 |
| **Procurement Category** | Goods and Services (GD) |

## Tender Description

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites firms to bid on a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the provision of a shallow water/bay water patrol boat for operations. The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) Conservation and Protection program requires a suitable vessel.

Key requirements include:

* Shallow water/bay water patrol boat for operations
* Standard boating equipment as required by Transport Canada
* Specified accessories
* Fitted trailer

## Submissions and Attachments

Submissions must be made through the SAP Ariba platform, and all documents will be provided in either English or French. This office provides procurement services in both official languages of Canada. The full RFP and attachments are accessible only after logging into a SAP Ariba account and completing the Government of Canada profile.

## Contact and Debriefing Information

For inquiries and debriefing requests, contact Rhonda O'Leary (SPAC/PSPC) at:

* Email: [rhonda.oleary@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:rhonda.oleary@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Phone: Not available
* Fax: Not available

Debriefing requests must be submitted within 15 working days of being informed that the bid was unsuccessful. A debriefing can be provided in writing, by phone, or in person.

## Contracting Entity

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is the contracting authority, and decisions will be made based on the evaluation of proposals. The contracting authority may choose to contract with one or more firms. Not all proposals received will be evaluated.

## Notice URL
